author: hustla187
title: Wave is Coming but I Ain't Have No Fear
review: This is a very cool but small set. It comes with a minifig and a surfboard with a sail. I like the surfboard alot because Lego doesn't make surfboards for minifigs anymore.  The sail is also pretty cool too. Whether you're not a surfer or a pro shredding it up at Trestles or Mavericks, this is a great set.

author: hispalugniano94
title: Un set necesario para ambientes playeros
review: Un set útil para ambientar una playa. No tiene mucho misterio, de hecho más que un set es un complemento. Tiene piezas interesantes por ejemplo la vela o la tabla. La minifig no corresponde mucho en vestimenta. Escasa jugabilidad. Muy swoosh. Lo siento pero si no entendéis el Español se siente, paso de escribirla en Inglés...

author: DocDanCan
title: Windsurfer
review:
I don't have much to say about this set more than to give the basics:
Minifig: Comes with hair, sunglasses on head, and life jacket (teaching kids water safety from a young age!)
Board: Great design, nice and long.
Sail: With the exception of maybe the pirate ships, you really don't see sets with this element. Looks great, and uses two bar pieces to hold it in place. I lost the horizontal bar, but have ordered a replacement bar from Bricklink, which is a fantastic resource.
Playability: Superb, especially if you have other beach/water/city sets.
Building experience: Basically nil.
Overall: Good set.
